com.fluidops.iwb.api
Class ReadWriteDataManagerImpl

java.lang.Object
  com.fluidops.iwb.api.ReadDataManagerImpl
      com.fluidops.iwb.api.ReadWriteDataManagerImpl
All Implemented Interfaces:
ReadDataManager, ReadWriteDataManager
public class ReadWriteDataManagerImpl
extends ReadDataManagerImpl
implements ReadWriteDataManager

Implementation of WriteDataManager methods. Performs safe transaction, i.e. batch action that are triggered are either executed completely or not at all. When calling methods from outside, the caller does not need to care about auto-committing, cache refresh, and keyword index refreshing; all of these tasks are handled internally. Extend with care!!!

Author:
msc

Method Detail

canBeWritten

public static boolean canBeWritten(org.openrdf.repository.Repository r)
Verify if the connection is writable in an actual write operation, i.e. add and remove some triple within a single transaction.

Parameters:
r -
Returns:
true if the write operation succeeds, false otherwiese

close

public void close()
Description copied from interface: ReadWriteDataManager
Closes the data manager by closing the inner connection. Should always be called (the finalize method tries this, too, but we actually don't know when it is called).

Specified by:
close in interface ReadWriteDataManager

openDataManager

public static ReadWriteDataManagerImpl openDataManager(org.openrdf.repository.Repository r)
To be used instead of the constructor. Clients do not need to catch RepositoryExceptions any more. Whenever one occurs, this class closes the connection so clients do no longer need to close the connection in the finally block.

loadData

public Context loadData(org.openrdf.model.URI source,
                        org.openrdf.model.URI group,
                        Context.ContextType sourceType,
                        Context.ContextLabel label,
                        org.openrdf.rio.RDFFormat format,
                        java.io.File f)
Description copied from interface: ReadWriteDataManager
Loads data for the source from a file. Data is written to a fresh context. More precisely, the method creates a fresh context for the src and writes data into this context. Other contexts of the given source are left unmodified. The context meta data is persisted internally.

Specified by:
loadData in interface ReadWriteDataManager
Parameters:
source - URI of the src
group - URI of the context group
sourceType - type of the context
label - label of the context
format - file format
f - the file from which to load data
Returns:
the (fresh) context in which data has been loaded

Loads data for the source from a statement list. Data is written to a fresh context. More precisely, the method creates a fresh context for the src and writes data into this context. Other contexts of the given source are left unmodified. The context meta data is persisted internally.

updateDataForSrc

public Context updateDataForSrc(org.openrdf.model.URI source,
                                org.openrdf.model.URI providerServiceParam,
                                Context.ContextType srcType,
                                Context.ContextLabel label,
                                java.util.Collection<org.openrdf.model.Statement> stmts,
                                java.lang.Long contextExpirationDateMS)
Description copied from interface: ReadWriteDataManager
Loads data for the source from a file and removes all data older than contextExpirationDateMS. If contextExpirationDateMS is zero, all previous data is deleted. Data is written to a fresh context. More precisely, the method creates a fresh context for the src and writes data into this context. Other contexts of the given source are left unmodified. The context meta data is persisted internally.

Specified by:
updateDataForSrc in interface ReadWriteDataManager
Parameters:
source - URI of the src
srcType - type of the context
label - Name for the context
stmts - The list of stmts to write
contextExpirationDateMS - the date after which the context expires
Returns:
the (fresh) context in which data has been loaded

updateDataForGroup

public void updateDataForGroup(org.openrdf.model.URI source,
                               org.openrdf.model.URI group,
                               org.openrdf.model.URI providerServiceParam,
                               Context.ContextType srcType,
                               Context.ContextLabel label,
                               java.util.Collection<org.openrdf.model.Statement> stmts,
                               java.util.Collection<org.openrdf.model.URI> omitContexts,
                               java.lang.Long contextExpirationDateMS)
Description copied from interface: ReadWriteDataManager
Loads data for the source from a file and removes all data older than contextExpirationDateMS from the given context group (must not be null). If contextExpirationDateMS is zero, all previous data is deleted. Data is written to a fresh context. More precisely, the method creates a fresh context for the src and writes data into this context. Other contexts of the given source are left unmodified. The context meta data is persisted internally.

Specified by:
updateDataForGroup in interface ReadWriteDataManager
Parameters:
source - the identifier of the source that writes the data
group - the group to which the generated context belongs
srcType - the context type
label - describing the context content
stmts - list of stmts to write in new context
omitContexts - list of source identifiers whose contexts should be omitted from deletion
contextExpirationDateMS - date for context expiration

                         Context context)
Description copied from interface: ReadWriteDataManager
Adds the triple to the specified context. Does not check for duplicates, i.e. also adds the triple if it is already contained in another context.

                         Context context)

addToContextWithoutPersist

public void addToContextWithoutPersist(java.util.Collection<org.openrdf.model.Statement> stmts,
                                       Context context)
Description copied from interface: ReadWriteDataManager
Adds the triples to the specified context but does not persist the context meta information, i.e. persistance of meta information must be handled outside. This is useful if a lot of individual requests write to the context, and there is no need to update the context meta information on each request. Does not check for duplicates, i.e. also adds the triples if they are already contained in another context. Context must not be null.

Specified by:
addToContextWithoutPersist in interface ReadWriteDataManager

removeInUserContexts

public java.util.Set<org.openrdf.model.URI> removeInUserContexts(org.openrdf.model.Statement stmt,
                                                                 Context changeLog)
Description copied from interface: ReadWriteDataManager
Removes matching statements from user contexts, independently from the context specified in the statement. In addition, if the statement's object is a literal, the datatype will be ignored when deleting, i.e. all statements with same subject, predicate and /object label/ will be deleted.

Specified by:
removeInUserContexts in interface ReadWriteDataManager
Parameters:
stmt - the statement to delete
Returns:
the set of modified contexts

removeStmtsFromGroup

public void removeStmtsFromGroup(java.util.Collection<org.openrdf.model.Statement> stmts,
                                 org.openrdf.model.URI group,
                                 java.util.Set<org.openrdf.model.URI> updatedContexts)
Description copied from interface: ReadWriteDataManager
Removes matching statements from all context associated to source that has associated the given group (if the group is null, nothing will happen). In contrast to the removeDate method, this method simply removes the statements "as is" from the contexts and does not have special handling for differences in data types. If you pass a parameter updatedContexts!=null, then the method will fill it with all contexts that have been updated, but NOT cleanup empty contexts automatically (this is very useful to optimize batch operations); if updateContexts==null, then the method will handle context updated internally.

Specified by:
removeStmtsFromGroup in interface ReadWriteDataManager
Parameters:
stmts - list of statements to delete

deleteContextById

public void deleteContextById(org.openrdf.model.Resource contextId)
Description copied from interface: ReadWriteDataManager
Delete context meta information and all contained triples. If the contextId is null, nothing will be deleted. If it is not an IWB-internal context, only the data in the context is deleted.

Specified by:
deleteContextById in interface ReadWriteDataManager
Parameters:
contextId - URI/resource of the context

deleteExpiredContextsOfSource

public void deleteExpiredContextsOfSource(org.openrdf.model.URI source,
                                          org.openrdf.model.URI inputParameter,
                                          java.util.Collection<org.openrdf.model.Resource> omitContexts,
                                          java.lang.Long expirationTimeMS)
Description copied from interface: ReadWriteDataManager
Delete all outdated contexts and context meta information of src. If src is null, nothing happens. The omitContexts parameter can be used to list contexts that are excluded from removal (you may also pass null).

Specified by:
deleteExpiredContextsOfSource in interface ReadWriteDataManager
Parameters:
source - the source whose contexts are to be retrieved
inputParameter - URI of context to delete
omitContexts - URIs of contexts to omit
expirationTimeMS - the time (in ms) after which a context is considered invalid (null means all contexts are outdated)

                                     org.openrdf.rio.RDFFormat rdfFormat)

Specified by:
importRDFfromInputStream in interface ReadWriteDataManager

calculateVoIDStatistics

public void calculateVoIDStatistics(org.openrdf.model.URI context)
Description copied from interface: ReadWriteDataManager
Calculates VoID (Vocabulary of Interlinked Datasets) statistics for a given URI. Can be invoked whenever a context is created or updated and statistics shall be calculated automatically without the user being required to do so via the UI (VoIDWidget).

Whenever this method is invoked, it first checks, whether there are already VoID statistics present for the given resource. If so, these statistics are deleted. Afterwards the statistics themselves are calculated.

Theoretically this method could be invoked using any valid URI, however for the time being it should only be used with a valid context (rdf:type System:Context) or null. Reason being if the resource is deleted currently the VoID statistics persist.

Specified by:
calculateVoIDStatistics in interface ReadWriteDataManager
Parameters:
context - The context of which VoID statistics are to be calculated. If set to null statistics of the complete repository are calculated.

sparqlUpdate

public void sparqlUpdate(java.lang.String query,
                         org.openrdf.model.Value resolveValue,
                         boolean infer,
                         Context context)
                  throws org.openrdf.query.MalformedQueryException,
                         org.openrdf.query.UpdateExecutionException
Description copied from interface: ReadWriteDataManager
Perform a SPARQL 1.1 update operation, i.e. DELETE or UPDATE. Internally namespace prefixes are replaced. An (optional) context can be provided, in which all metadata is persisted (iff triples have been added to the context). This context is also used to replace the special variable $usercontext$ within the query string. Note that a context must be given, if the query string contains $usercontext$ (otherwise you will run into IllegalArgumentExceptions)

Specified by:
sparqlUpdate in interface ReadWriteDataManager
resolveValue - the value used for ??
context - the context to be used for metadata or null
Throws:
org.openrdf.query.MalformedQueryException
org.openrdf.query.UpdateExecutionException
